companyDescription:
We are Canada’s leading foodservice and support services company.

Compass Group Canada is the country’s leading foodservice and support services provider with over 25,000 associates working in more than 2,200 location throughout the country. The company specializes in providing foodservices and support services across the core sectors including leading sports and leisure venues, executive dining rooms and cafes, schools, universities, seniors’ residences and hospitals as well as remote camps and off shore oil rigs.
description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.
  You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!
  Imagine a place where people work as one to create an experience that inspires many. Join us and know that you make it possible for friends, families, and co-workers to come together. No matter why they gather, we’re here to serve. Because of what we do, people share so much more than a meal. And that’s why this is so much more than a job.
  Why work with Eurest Dining? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading food and support Services Company. We provide diverse, innovative dining services to corporate headquarter locations, law firms, manufacturing facilities, distribution centres and call centres. Join our commitment to providing exceptional food service to the best of business and industry.
 
  
   
     Job Details
   
   
     Location: 501 Smyth Road, Ottawa ON
     Start Date: ASAP Status: Full-Time Schedule: 11:00am -7:00 pm Wage: $18.11
   
  
  
   
     Job Summary
   
   
     Assists the Manager on duty with the coordination of activities of associates within the food service department while maintaining the highest standards and levels of customer service.
     Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
    
      Assist the Shift Managers to supervise multiple food service units.
      Supervise the production of menu items, ensure completion of cash readings, manage associates, schedule staff working hours, hire and train employees.
      Learn from and assist the Shift Manager to resolve labour relation issues, track and produce reports on weekly inventories, sales revenue, labour and food cost.
      Communicate positively and enthusiastically to the café patrons and address their issues promptly.
      Ensure strict compliance with Compass’ Quality Assurance and Health and Safety Program, Occupational Health and Safety Act and WHMIS regulations.
      Coordinate frequent workplace inspections and WHMIS training of all staff and promptly report any workplace accident or incident to head office.
      Ensure Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) standards are followed in the food preparation process.
    
     Qualifications:
     Think you have what it takes to be our Food Service Supervisors? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you’ll be successful in the role.
    
      At least one year of strong operation food industry management experience.
      FoodSafe Level 1 Certification.
      Comprehensive health and safety knowledge and training.
      Knowledge of food service catering.
      Strong supervisory skills and the capability to motivate and lead staff.
      Employee relations experience in a unionized environment is an asset.
      Excellent customer service skills.
      Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
      Knowledge of Microsoft Office.
    
   
  
 
  Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.
 
  For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

Manager, Research Services
   
   
     Description
    
      Reporting to the Vice Chair (VC) of Research, the Manager, Research Services is responsible for a positive work culture, the development, implementation, and maintenance of work practices to permit the delivery of high-quality and efficient research coordination services while building excellence and capacity to respond to the research portfolio within the Department of Medicine (DoM). This includes managing a team, the administration and distribution of workload, communicating across teams, and performing quality control and assurance activities as required. The Manager develops processes and procedures, ensures fair and equitable access to resources, and identifies and addresses opportunities to improve processes and support and facilitate projects and communication to increase research productivity and impact.
    
   
   
     Responsibilities
    
     
      
        (This is not a complete list):
      
     
     
       Work with the VC of Research, the VC of Member Support, and Technical Solutions Office (TSO) to develop and maintain an online “hub” for researchers to navigate the complexity of the researcher environment
       Ensures equity in accessing Office services and resources
       Manages the staff of the Research Office, prioritizes and delegates workload to meet multiple demands, ensuring deadlines are met; provides guidance/training/coaching to Research Office employees
       Provide operational support to Vice-Chair of Research, including preparing and managing the annual Office budget
       Monitors the Office’s programs and service offerings and makes appropriate recommendations to capitalize on opportunities, mitigate risk, and resolve issues
       Build and maintain productive and supportive relationships to facilitate research within DOM
       Provide advice and guidance on funding opportunities, complex REB submissions, ethics proposals, publications, etc.
       Manage compliance, limitations, and maintenance of the internal research output measurement system
       Coordinate operational support for the Research Plus Program and the Director, Medical Education Research
       Works to develop strategies to increase the visibility of DoM’s research accomplishments and promote research events and activities
     
    
   
   
     Qualifications
    
     
       Minimum of 7 years of experience in clinical research at an academic hospital is strongly preferred, including but not limited to clinical trial management, and academic-led studies.
       Familiarity with scientometrics
       Experience with research ethics guidelines, applications and REB requirements
       Familiarity with concepts of The San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment (DORA)
       Demonstrated relevant clinical research knowledge
       A minimum of 5 years supervisory/management experience
       Working knowledge of clinical research standards and regulations governing human research ethics
       Ability to set priorities, work under pressure and meet deadlines with an attention to detail
       Experience in leadership, mentoring, and creating positive working relationships, demonstrating tact and diplomacy
       Experiencing with managing a budgets and metric reporting
       Ability to handle highly sensitive and confidential information
       Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
       Client service oriented, with the ability to work effectively in a highly diverse environment
       Ability to exercise judgement and make decisions while working with minimal supervision
       Proficiency in speaking and comprehending both English and French (Level B+) is an asset
     
    
   
   
     Contacts
    
      To apply for this exciting opportunity, please forward your resume and cover letter, quoting the corresponding position title, by email at domcareers@toh.ca
      IMPORTANT NOTICE: Support staff are employees of the University of Ottawa Medical Associates. The Ottawa Hospital is the paymaster of our employees. Although our employees have offices within the Ottawa Hospital, they are not employed by the Ottawa Hospital. Please note, all employees must provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination prior to hire.
      The University of Ottawa Medical Associates is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees. The University of Ottawa Medical Associates will, upon request, provide accommodations in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
     Hiring organization
   
   
   
    
      Employment Type
    
    
      Full-time
    
   
   
    
      Duration of employment
    
    
      Permanent
    
   
   
    
      Industry
    
    
      Healthcare
    
   
   
    
      Job Location
    
    
      501 Smyth Road, Ottawa, ON, Ontario, Canada
    
   
   
    
      Base Salary
    
    
      $55.872-$69.167
      Per hour
    
   
   
    
     
      
        Valid through
      
      
        February 10, 2024

companyDescription: With nearly 100,000 employees — including architects, engineers, designers, planners, scientists and management and construction services professionals — serving clients in more than 150 countries around the world following the acquisition of URS, AECOM is a premier, fully integrated infrastructure and support services firm. AECOM is ranked as the #1 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine’s annual industry rankings. The company is a leader in all of the key markets that it serves, including transportation, facilities, environmental, energy, oil and gas, water, high-rise buildings and government. AECOM provides a blend of global reach, local knowledge, innovation and technical excellence in delivering solutions that create, enhance and sustain the world’s built, natural and social environments. A Fortune 500 company, AECOM companies, including URS Corporation and Hunt Construction Group, had revenue of approximately $19.5 billion during the 12 months ended Sept. 30, 2014. More information on AECOM and its services can be found at www.aecom.com.
description:
Company Description 

 Work with Us. Change the World. 

 At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. 

 There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. 

 We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us. 

 Job Description 

 AECOM Canada Nuclear Services at Chalk River Nuclear Laboratories is searching for a Field Management Supervisor for a full-time position based at Chalk River, supporting the Construction Management Team at the site. 

 
GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 The Site Inspection Lead (SIL) is responsible for technical and quality inspections of civil, geotechnical, mechanical, electrical, and architectural installations, as well as surveillance and witnessing of work performed by other trades. The SIL will lead a team of qualified discipline inspectors and subcontractors with the primary responsibility of performing independent testing, surveillance, oversight and witnessing of activities related to procurement, construction, and commissioning of nuclear facilities. These duties include, but are not limited to, preparing & implementing inspection and test procedures, identifying installation, product & process issues, implementing the nonconformance process through records and tracking systems, and performing independent testing of electrical, civil, geotechnical, mechanical (including piping, pressure vessels) and architectural. 

 
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 Support projects in the execution of Quality Control Programs. Position responsibilities include: 

 + Supervise inspection and testing personnel. 

 + Plan and coordinate site-wide inspection and testing operations. 

 + Review project Inspection & Testing Plans (ITP) and other Project Plans, as needed. 

 + Prepare and review test reports. 

 + Participate in independent quality oversight, surveillance and witnessing of field activities and installations. 

 + Participate in independent sampling, testing and material receipt inspection. 

 + Support the preparation and implementation of project inspection/assessment strategies and reports to cover all project phases. 

 + Support reporting and addressing of corrective and preventive actions and analysis and trending of quality data. 

 + Liaise with client and contractor quality representatives, and project members to ensure that all quality issues are documented and resolved. 

 + Interface and coordinate with clients, contractors, and inspection & testing agencies on QC matters; oversee related inspection & testing activities for quality and conformance to deliverable requirements. 

 + Coordinate QC deliverables and documentation; participate in QC planning activities. 

 
Necessary Skills and Knowledge:
 The skills and knowledge to execute this role are usually acquired through 15+ years of relevant construction experience, preferably in a nuclear environment. The individual would possess good written and verbal skills. 

 Qualifications 

 
Minimum Requirements:
 + Engineering Degree in a related field + 6 Yr of related experience or 

 + Diploma/Certificate Quality Engineer + 8 yrs or more of related experience. 

 
Strongly Preferred Qualifications:
 + P.Eng, Certified Technologist, or Certified Quality Engineer. 

 + A minimum of six years of multi-discipline QC inspection and testing, or equivalent experience. 

 + Demonstrated leadership experience supervising multi-discipline construction teams. 

 + Experience in water treatment plant construction. 

 + Experience in environmental remediation construction, including municipal landfill sites. 

 + Demonstrated ability to understand drawings and specifications. 

 + Demonstrated knowledge and ability in the application of QC procedures, inspection and testing techniques. 

 + Demonstrated good analytical skills and familiarity with quality tools and methodologies. 

 + Demonstrated knowledge of best practices for inspection, testing, quality control and defect management. 

 Additional Information 

 Offered rate of compensation in Chalk River will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience. The salary range for this position is $ 110K- $150K. 

 About AECOM 

 AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM. 

 Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity 

 You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. 

 You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. 

 AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. 

 Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. 

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 

 
ReqID: J10102387 

 
Business Line: Energy 

 
Business Group: DCS 

 
Strategic Business Unit: Canada 

 
Career Area: Construction 

 
Work Location Model: On-Site

GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 Site Nuclear Quality Assurance / Quality Control Specialist is responsible for supporting the Quality scopes of work for nuclear projects. The primary responsibility is to perform independent surveillance, oversight and witnessing of activities related to procurement, construction and maintenance projects. These duties include but are not limited to preparing & implementing quality assurance policies & procedures, performing scheduled quality audits & assessments, identifying product & process issues, , implementing the nonconformance process through records and tracking systems, and performing cause analysis and corrective actions. 

 
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 Support Nuclear Quality Manager in the execution of the Quality Assurance Program. Position responsibilities include: 

 + Review Project Quality Plans (PQP), Inspection & Testing Plans (ITP) and other Project Plans, as needed. 

 + Participate in independent quality oversight, surveillance and witnessing of field activities and installations. 

 + Participate in independent sampling and measurement testing, receipt inspection and factory acceptance testing. 

 + Prepare and implement the project inspection/assessment strategies and reports to cover all project phases. 

 + Ensure that all non-conformance issues are promptly investigated, corrective and preventive actions are proposed/implemented and are closed out in a timely manner; assist in trending and analyzing quality data. 

 + Liaise with client and contractor quality representatives, and project members to ensure that all quality issues are resolved. 

 + Interface and coordinate with clients, contractors, and inspection & testing agencies on QC matters; oversee related inspection & testing activities for quality and conformance to deliverable requirements. 

 + Assist in the maintenance of the Quality Assurance Manuals and Procedures to ensure compliance with all applicable codes and standards. 

 + Support ACNS Quality Manager with the delivery of Nuclear QA Indoctrination Training. 

 + Coordinate QA/QC deliverables and documentation. 

 + Participate in QA/QC planning activities.

 The skills and knowledge to execute this role are usually acquired through 5+ years of experience in a nuclear environment. The individual would possess good written and verbal skills. 

 Qualifications 

 
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor Degree in a relevant field + 6 yrs experience in QA/QC roles or: 

 Diploma/Certificate (Canada) + 8yrs related experience 

 
Strongly Preferred Qualifications:
 + Demonstrated knowledge and ability in the application of QA and procurement principles 

 + Demonstrated history in reviewing and controlling Quality documents. 

 + Demonstrated implementation, documentation & monitoring experience in the development & application of ISO 9001, CSA N299 series, CSA N286, CSA N286.7, and CSA N285. 

 + Demonstrated working knowledge and experience in External & Internal Quality Audits 

 + Demonstrated good analytical skills and familiarity with quality tools and methodologies – RCA 

 + Demonstrated knowledge of best practices for inspection, testing, quality control and defect management 

 + Minimum 6 years’ experience in QA/QC roles in the nuclear industry 

 Additional Information 

 Offered rate of compensation in Chalk River will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience. The salary range for this position is $105K- $140K. 

 About AECOM 

 AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

description:
Date posted
    January 22, 2024
  
  
    Title
    Quality Assurance Coordinator
  
  
    Status
    Permanent
  
  
    Language
    Bilingualism in both official languages is preferred
  
  
    Salary Range
    $ 51,425 - $65,038
  
  
    Closing Date
    February 2, 2024
  
   
 
  Service Coordination Support for People with Developmental Disabilities (SCS) is a not-for-profit bilingual organization managed by a volunteer Board of Directors. SCS helps people with a developmental disability and their families who reside in the Ottawa region. SCS serves adults and children by providing information, referral services and case management support. One of our important goals is to empower families/individuals to make informed choices about the supports they seek.
  Primary Focus
  Reporting directly to the Manager, Evaluation and Performance Improvement, the Quality Assurance Coordinator is primarily responsible for reporting Serious Occurrences to the Ministry for all Outside Paid Resource Providers (OPRs) that SCS has a signed service agreement with. The Quality Assurance Coordinator will also be responsible to follow-up on Serious Occurrence Reports submitted by SCS and will oversee the agency’s adherence to the reporting requirements. The Quality Assurance Coordinator will also complete requests and tasks supporting the work and objectives of the Evaluation and Performance team, within prescribed deadlines, which will have an impact on the quality of our services and the attainment of our organizational objectives.
  Major Responsibilities
  Serious Occurrences related functions (corresponds to approximately 70% of the workload, which can vary based on operational needs)
 
   Complete Serious Occurrence reports on behalf of all OPRs sites/programs and third-party service providers, which encompasses the following actions:
   
     Daily surveillance and triage of the Shared Serious Occurrence Inbox for manual Serious Occurrence reports.
     Communicate with the OPRs and SCS staff to clarify Serious Occurrence incidents, as required.
     Submit Serious Occurrence reports on the SOR-RL online database and internal database.
     Follow-up with the OPRs when further actions have been identified, or when adherence to specific QAM requirements needs to be confirmed.
     Submit Serious Occurrence updates on the SOR-RL online database, as per Ministry directives and Serious Occurrence Reporting guidelines.
     Identify training opportunities for OPRs sites/programs and third-party provider when trends or patterns of Serious Occurrence reporting emerges.
   
   Track statistics for internal and external purposes. Maintain metrics documents and revise as needed.
   Oversee SCS’ adherence to the Serious Occurrence reporting guidelines and expectations, by reviewing all SCS Serious Occurrence reports prepared by SCS staff, prior to submitting to the Ministry, and following-up with SCS staff on any outstanding reports they have initially submitted on the online platform.
   Provide ongoing training and coaching to SCS staff and OPR representatives on Serious Occurrence Reporting guidelines and expectations.
 
  Administrative functions (corresponds to approximately 30% of the workload, which can vary based on operational needs)
 
   Support the Evaluation and Performance team by:
   
     Organizing and scheduling agency training provided by members of the Evaluation and Performance team.
     Preparing agenda and writing meeting minutes for the Evaluation and Performance team meetings.
     Completing data entry for members of the Evaluation and Performance team, when required.
     Participating in data analysis and interpretation for various reports produced by the Evaluation and Performance team
     Participating in SCS internal audit sessions, as per the Internal Audit Framework (in development).
   
   Support SCS’ feedback process by sending invitations to individuals receiving services from SCS to complete the online client satisfaction survey, and by providing information to the Manager, Evaluation and Performance Improvement about individuals requesting that we contact them directly to discuss their feedback.
   Completing other related tasks as required.
 
  Knowledge and Skills
 
   A College Degree in Administrative Services and/or Social Services (College Degree) supplemented by at least two (2) years of previous work experience in an office administration or customer service environment or related field. Equivalent experience will also be considered.
   Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Internet along with experience working with databases.
   Above average oral, written and interpersonal communication skills in both official languages (French & English) preferred.
   Must have strong analytical, reasoning, presentation and facilitation skills.
   Must be highly organized and detail oriented.
   Excellent organizational and time management skills to meet scheduled deadlines.
   Ability to work in a fast paced environment and handle a number of issues simultaneously.
   The nature of the work requires to have a high degree of concentration and attention.
   Experience working with an Electronic Client Records system is an asset.
 
  Working Conditions
  Working conditions are normal for a hybrid remote working environment. Business hours are regular with some overtime when required. Attend meetings locally and potentially regionally.
  Accommodations
  Service Coordination (SCS) has an accommodation process in place and provides accommodations for candidates and employees with specific needs. If you require specific accommodations, please contact the Human Resources to arrange appropriate accommodations.
  As the ideal candidate you are a self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills who works well in a virtual team environment. Qualified candidates may submit their resumes, along with a cover letter quoting Competition Number 03 – 2024 by February 2, 2024 at 4:30pm to Human Resources.
  While we appreciate all responses, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. We kindly ask not to send in duplicate copies of your resume.
  SCS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represents the communities we serve. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, skills and business need.

companyDescription:
We want to help you do what you do best. At CBI Health, our extensive national network is here to help you increase your local impact. By joining our care team, you’ll receive the independence and experienced support structure you need to provide life-changing care for your clients and their families. And while you do that, our team of over 13,000 healthcare professionals has your back!

For millions of Canadians, CBI Health is where better begins. We are Canada’s leading community healthcare provider, reliably delivering innovative Rehabilitation and Home Health care programs that help our clients achieve their health goals. With 250+ locations in more than 800 communities, people are at the heart of what we do. Every day, all across the country, our team members work together to make a meaningful difference in our clients’ lives and help shape healthcare for the better. 
Learn more about CBI Health.

Company Mission/Culture
People are at the heart of what we do. Together, we serve local clients and communities by delivering nationally supported Rehabilitation and Home Health services. We also serve every member of our team by helping them achieve their health career goals through meaningful work and impactful outcomes.

Our Purpose, Promise, and Values are what inform and guide this mission. These essential elements are at the heart of the decisions we make, the programs we implement, and the strategies we develop. Across the country, the CBI Health team is committed to delivering on Our Purpose, keeping Our Promise, and living Our Values in every community we serve.

Our Purpose: The health and well-being of Canadians is at the heart of what we do. Every day, we make a meaningful difference in people’s lives by supporting them in achieving their goals. Together, we shape healthcare for the better. 

Our Promise: For our clients, we promise to always:  
Treat you with dignity, respect and kindness 
Understand you, your goals and what matters most 
Engage, motivate, and inspire you on your health journey 
Bring together our knowledge, expertise and experience to deliver the best care 
Earn and appreciate the trust you place in us 

Our Values:
Heart – We are passionate about making a positive difference 
Respect – We accept and value everyone 
Reliability – We do what we say we will do 
Teamwork – We work well together and support each other 
Innovation – We are committed to learning, improving and growing.
 
Learn more about the CBI Health culture.

Diversity Programs and Initiatives: CBI Health continually strives to be an inclusive organization and create a respectful work environment where everyone feels included and valued. Diversity in our workplace allows us to share and implement different perspectives, which we believe inevitably leads to better internal and external outcomes. Accepting and valuing everyone, part of Our Values, ensures that the CBI Health culture is strong, enhances the well-being of all team members, and allows us to effectively work together to fulfill Our Purpose: shaping healthcare for the better. 

Our employee-led Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) Committee is now in its third year running and continues to make great progress in developing meaningful initiatives to help team members feel safe and accepted as their authentic selves. Creating impactful new DEI initiatives and enhancing existing initiatives will remain a CBI Health priority moving forward.

Awards: CBI Health is proud to be a national leader in the field of community healthcare. We are regularly recognized for our exemplary Rehabilitation and Home Health expertise, as well as our commitment to industry-recognized organizational best practices.
description:
Physiotherapist, $5,000 Signing Bonus! – Kanata, ON 
  CBI Health is Canada’s leading community healthcare provider, and our passionate team is at the heart of what we do. Every day, our 13,000 staff make a meaningful difference in our clients’ lives as we live the core values that define us: heart, respect, reliability, teamwork and innovation. Along with mentoring and continuous learning opportunities to help advance your career, we are building a culture of inspiration, recognition and celebration for the meaningful work our team does every day, all across the country. Join CBI Health and find where your better begins. 
  About this opportunity 
  Are you looking for a company that supports innovative, evidence-based approaches to rehabilitation? Then CBI Health has a great opportunity for you to join our interdisciplinary team! As a Physiotherapist at our Kanata health centres, you’ll have all the tools and resources you need to grow your practice and develop your skills. Through the support of our leadership, you’ll continuously set and reach new goals. After all, our commitment to excellence goes beyond the way we serve our communities. We’ll empower you to enrich lives and achieve amazing results by doing what you do best. 
  Take an inside look at what you’ll do each day 
 
  Work with clients to develop and implement individualized treatment plans, directed towards maintaining and enhancing their physical abilities, lifestyle and well-being 
  Be responsible for managing and prioritizing clinical caseloads, and for the coordination and delivery of therapeutic services 
  Participate in a collaborative care model providing holistic, comprehensive care to meet the needs of clients 
  Promote positive relationships between clients, team members, funders and the community 
 
 What you need to be successful 
 
  You are a graduate of a recognized School of Physiotherapy 
  Registration in good standing with the College of Physiotherapists of Ontario 
  Passion about your profession and committed to ongoing professional development 
  A strong client-centered approach 
 
 What CBI Health offers you 
 
  Continuous learning and skills development, including management opportunities 
  Training and mentoring from a national network of experts 
  Competitive compensation with comprehensive benefits and rewards package, including group health, dental and vision benefits, paid 100% by the employer 
  Excellent administrative support, so you can focus on your patients 
  Flexible hours, which allow work-life balance and focus on quality of life 
  A signing bonus of $5,000! 
  
 About Us 
  For millions of Canadians, CBI Health is where better begins. We are Canada’s leading community healthcare provider, reliably delivering innovative rehabilitation and home care programs that help our clients achieve their health goals. With 250+ locations and supporting more than 800 communities, people are at the heart of what we do. Every day, all across the country, our 13,000 staff work together to make a meaningful difference in our clients’ lives and help shape healthcare for the better. Learn more at cbihealth.ca. 
  CBI Health is proud to be recognized by Deloitte as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for the 15th year in a row. A huge thank you to all our team members, whose dedication, passion, and innovation have enabled us to achieve this recognition year after year. 
  CBI Health is committed to providing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels safe and accepted as their authentic selves. We actively seek qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion and contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives that help us innovate and provide the best possible care to our clients. 
 We are committed to fostering a positive experience for all Indigenous applicants whether you’re First Nations (status or non-status), Inuit or Metis and welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristics that make each of us different. 
  In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and CBI Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of our hiring process. Please inform your recruiter if you have any accommodation requests. 
  #NREHAB

companyDescription:
The Ottawa Hospital is one of Canada’s largest learning and research hospitals, with more than 1,100 beds, approximately 12,000 staff members and an annual budget of about $1.2 billion. 

Our focus on learning and research helps us develop new and innovative ways to treat patients and improve care. As a multi-campus hospital affiliated with the University of Ottawa, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region, but our techniques and research discoveries are adopted around the world. We engage the community at all levels to support our vision for better patient care.

From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges.

description:
Martello Technologies is headquartered in Ottawa, Canada with employees in Canada, Europe, and the United States. We provide Microsoft digital experience monitoring (DEM) solutions that monitor the performance of cloud collaboration and productivity tools to give enterprises insight into the user experience. Our products include unified communications (UC) performance analytics software, Microsoft 365 user experience monitoring software, and IT analytics software.
  
  
  The Vice President of Research and Development plays a pivotal leadership role in driving innovation, maintaining competitiveness, and contributing to the long-term success of the company. The ability to balance strategic thinking, technical expertise, and effective leadership is essential for success in this role. The VP of R&D is a member of the senior leadership team and will lead the global operations, infrastructure, customer care, and product delivery functions for the company’s cloud services and will identify requirements, manage priorities, provide status, manage budgets, and ultimately ensure that product and service delivery are on time, on budget and of maximum quality.
  
  
  Your responsibilities will include: 
  
  Collaborate with executive leadership to ensure R&D efforts align with the company’s vision and mission. 
  Manage the vision, design, and development of cloud infrastructure, including compute, storage, and network systems for cloud hosting. 
  Responsible for running 24x7x365 cloud infrastructure and operations organization. 
  Develop and manage the R&D budget, ensuring efficient use of resources. 
  Evaluate government funding programs and propose to senior management the programs that are best suited for Martello. Contribute to the reporting and management requirements for these government programs. 
  Monitor progress, milestones, and deliverables to ensure alignment with timelines and objectives. 
  Establish key KPI’s, SLA’s, and performance scorecards demonstrating department health. Communicate through operational reviews. Measure and track against industry benchmarks and standards. 
  Evaluate the potential of new technologies for adoption or integration into Martello’s products and processes. 
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product management, to bring products to market successfully. 
  Manage the company’s intellectual property portfolio, including patents, trademarks, and trade secrets. 
  Ensure that R&D activities comply with legal and regulatory requirements. 
  Cultivate relationships with external partners, research institutions, and industry experts to enhance collaboration and access external expertise. 
  Implement measures to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards. 
  Effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences. 
  Implement and oversee quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability and performance of developed products. 
  Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the R&D department, optimizing processes and workflows.
 
  
  
  Requirements: 
  An undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering 
  At least 10 years of experience in leading R&D teams, including a minimum of five years in a senior management role. 
  
  Excellent written communication skills including architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams 
  Excellent presentation skills, in particular to senior stakeholders such as other executives or board of directors. 
  Experience with Agile, Design Thinking, and Lean Methodologies (e.g. Lean UX, Lean Canvas) 
  5+ years of experience managing high-volume mission-critical SaaS applications. 
  5+ years of experience in 24x7x365 cloud and SaaS operations 
  Direct experience driving continuous improvements in process and operational efficiencies. Drive best practices across cross functional teams. 
  Excellent project management skills and ability to work to deadlines managing multiple business-driven initiatives. 
  Experience with market and competitive analysis, and driving long-term product strategy.
 
  
  
  The ideal candidate is a progressive leader who effectively collaborates with a team-focused approach and will mentor, support, and develop their research and development team members. You are hands-on, lead by example, and value the importance of working closely with stakeholders external and internal. As a member of the Senior Leadership Team, you appreciate the value and need to be “present” while working from our head office in Kanata, Ontario.

companyDescription:

description:
Stella-Jones is North America's leading producer of industrial pressure-treated wood products. Responding to the vital infrastructure needs of our economy, we manufacture and distribute railway ties, utility poles, residential lumber and industrial wood products across the continent. The Company’s common shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: SJ). 

 Stella-Jones recruits team members who embody our core values and desire an environment where growth is inspired, dedication is recognized, and achievement is rewarded. Our ever- expanding footprint provides a great prospect for career advancement as we seek to develop our emerging leaders. 

 Position Summary 
The Territory Manager is a self-motivated, energetic, and passionate team player who manages a territory for a national retail account. Drives sales, service stores, develops relationships with store Managers and Department associates. Maintains and improves knowledge of store associates. Maintains a home office. 

 
Responsibilities:
 
 
 Weekly visits to Home Depot stores in the Ottawa region. In season average one time per week. 8-12 stores in higher populated areas. 
 Ensures inventory levels are maintained, ensuring job lot quantities on shelves. Suggested orders provided if stock is required 
 Helps build a strong relationship with Pro Desk and lumber department 
 Helps build a strong relationship with HD team. Working closely with Senior Management in store to target new and existing Pro Contractor business 
 Communicate shipments directly with Pro team and Contractor 
 Establish and maintain relationship with Pro Contractor. Work with the Pro’s to educate them on all products and programs available in the market. 
 This can be done virtually or in person 
 Ensures all Stella-Jones products are serviced, presented well and maintained 
 Maintenance of store displays, literature, and signage. 
 Ensures all displays and signage are well maintained to Home Depot and Stella-Jones standards 
 Facilitates the return of defective product or incorrectly shipped product - RTV (return to vendor) 
 Verifies shipping and receiving issues at the stores to ensure proper invoicing by Stella-Jones and payment by Home Depot during peak season daily or scheduled 
 Gives ongoing product knowledge training to Home Depot associates prior to season starts or throughout the year, as necessary 
 Warranty claims and site inspections. Assists customers or stores in processing claims, either by providing manufacture warranty procedures or if necessary, site inspections to customer’s home (accompanied by a Home Depot Manager) 
 Participation in Home Depot events and shows. (virtual or live) Could include PK (product knowledge) and demos for customers and associates 
 Performs other duties as required 
 As a Stella-Jones employee, you will enjoy access to excellent benefits and incentives, including: 

 
 Extended health and dental coverage 
 Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) 
 Short-Term and Long-Term disability coverage 
 Competitive compensation 
 Annual Profit Share Program 
 Retirement program (RRSP) with generous Company match (150% of employee's 4% contribution) 
 Company Share Purchase Program with 10% Company contribution match 
 Career advancement opportunities 
 Stella-Jones is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, provincial, or local laws. 

 This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Stella-Jones makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

SUMMARY OF JOB DESCRIPTION
Under the direction of the Manager of the Technology Access Centre in Bio-innovation, the incumbents will support applied research activities in the laboratory. He/she will complete the laboratory experiment necessary to achieve the project goals.
REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
- The candidate must have graduated in the field of study of Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Chemistry-biology, Microbiology or a related field.- The candidate must show written and oral skills in French.- Previous experience in a research laboratory will be considered an asset.
MAIN DUTIES
Support in carrying out applied research project activities- Prepare and perform the laboratory experiment;- Perform demonstrations and provide technical explanations to students involved in research projects;- Communicate the progress of their tasks regularly with the Research Associates and Supervisor;- Participate, as needed, in meetings related to the research projects in which he/she is involved;- Prepare equipment and supplies necessary to ensure the progression of research projects;- Ensure the order and cleanliness of laboratories dedicated to applied research and shared laboratories;
----
DESCRIPTION SOMMAIRE DU POSTE
Sous la direction du superviseur du Centre d’accès à la technologie en bio-innovation, le titulaire soutient la réalisation des activités de recherche appliquée qui se déroulent en laboratoire. Il est responsable de préparer et d’effectuer la réalisation des expériences de laboratoires.

FONCTIONS PRINCIPALES
- Appui dans la réalisation des activités en recherche appliquée reliées aux projets :- Effectuer les manipulations de laboratoire nécessaire au projet- Faire des démonstrations et fournir des explications techniques aux étudiants impliqués dans les projets de recherche ;- Communiquer régulièrement aux associés de recherche et à son superviseur l’avancement dans ses tâches ;- Participer, au besoin, à des rencontres en lien avec les projets de recherche auxquels il participe ;- Préparer les appareils et équipements nécessaires au bon fonctionnement des projets de recherche;- Assurer l’ordre et la propreté des laboratoires dédiés à la recherche appliquée et les laboratoires partagés

Leisure Days RV Group is the 4th largest RV dealership group in North America, and largest RV Dealership group in Canada with over 36 dealerships in 4 provinces - British Columbia, Ontario, Nova Scotia, and New Brunswick.
Ottawa Camping Trailers (a subsidiary of Leisure Days RV Group Inc.) is seeking an effective and charismatic RV Sales Professional to join its store. This is a full-time, commission-based position.
If you are motivated by the thrill of a sale or a win, you may be just the person we are looking for!
Overview:
The RV Sales Professional matches customers with the best recreational vehicle (RV) for their travel and lifestyle needs. As with all positions within dealerships, sales professionals are expected to uphold the highest ethical standards. People working within the automotive retail industry often must work extended hours, evenings, and weekends to achieve their goals.
This position is eligible for company benefits, and fully compensated with salary + commission pay, with annual earnings in the range of $50,000 - $70,000.
Reports to: General Manager, Ottawa Camping Trailers
Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities:

 Ensure an unforgettable client experience by connecting on a personal level with the client to make every interaction meaningful.
 Assist customers to select the right RV for their lifestyle and individual needs through an exceptional sales and service process.
 Highlight and educate customers on the features and benefits of various RV's during sales presentations.
 Help clients, enthusiastic about the product, and ready to close successful deal.
 Build rapport with customers, answer inquiries and competently resolve any concerns.
 Complete necessary documentation accurately
 Follow up with customers to build trust and confidence.
 Grow sales and profit within customer base.
 Highly motivated and ambitious
 Dedicated to deliver incredible results to clients.

Essential Skills:

 Be a problem-solving champion, by listening and asking questions and leading with empathy any of the client concerns.
 Solid understanding of finance and payment plans
 Possess entrepreneurial mindset, by acting like an owner, taking accountability for issues, and knowing when to collaborate and use your team to find the right solutions.
 Deeply understand the products offered by the dealership, and proactively recommend products that will help achieve their financial goals.
 Reliable, strong work ethic, professional appearance is a must.
 Strong communication skills, verbal and written, with the ability to listen and provide solutions to customer issues.
 Should have a passion to do a great job and strive to exceed expectation.
 Must possess strong conflict resolution skills.
 Highly motivated and ambitious.
 Dedicated to deliver incredible results to clients.

Qualifications:

 Minimum High School Diploma or Equivalent.
 Outside sales: 1 year (preferred), and sales: 1 year (preferred).
 Valid G driver's license with clean and acceptable driving record.
 RV and/or automotive sales experience an asset.
 Provincially licensed, or able to be licensed, as recognized by the MVDA (OMVIC).
 Willing to work evening and weekend shifts.

All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.
We would like to thank all applicants for applying; however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Applications received will be maintained on file for a period of 6 months and may be referenced for future staffing requirements.

ROLE OVERVIEW
As the Client Experience Manager at Le Petit Salon, your mission is to cultivate an exceptional salon atmosphere that stands out in the beauty industry. This role goes beyond managing operations and dives into creating an environment where each client's visit is not just an appointment but a high-end and personalized retreat.
Your leadership and strategic vision are crucial in setting the tone for a premium client experience. You will ensure that every detail, from the greeting at the door to the final farewell, is carefully curated to reflect the salon's commitment to luxury and individual attention. Your role is to empower your team to deliver services that not only meet but surpass client expectations, turning every visit into a memorable and transformative experience.
Your focus on nurturing a culture of excellence and attention to detail will make Le Petit Salon the go-to destination for clients seeking a blend of top-tier beauty services and an unrivaled salon journey.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Client Experience Strategy:

 Design and implement strategies to elevate the client journey, ensuring a seamless, luxurious, and personalized experience.

Team Leadership:

 Lead and motivate the support staff, instilling a culture of excellence, teamwork, and ongoing improvement.
 Treat all clients, co-workers, and management with respect, professionalism, and kindness.

Service Quality Assurance:

 Uphold the highest service standards, swiftly addressing issues to maintain client loyalty.

Training and Development:

 Equip support staff with the necessary skills and knowledge to deliver outstanding service.
 Participate in training sessions and team meetings.
 Develop and continuously improve the client experience by updating procedures and training material.

Client Feedback Management:

 Collect and utilize client feedback to enhance service quality and satisfaction.

Operational Efficiency:

 Oversee client-facing salon operations, including appointment management, reception duties, and overall salon upkeep.

Client Relationship Management:

 Cultivate, nurture and maintain relationships with clients, promoting loyalty and repeat business.

Staff Management & Coordination:

 Ensure cohesive teamwork between support staff and stylists to meet client expectations effectively.
 Conduct regular staff evaluations and provide constructive feedback.

Customer Service:

 o Work hands-on at the reception desk and perform duties that meet and exceed Le Petit Salon’s client experience standards.

Driving Sales:

 Implement strategies and techniques to boost salon sales and promote upselling of products and services.

Labour Management:

 Optimize staff scheduling and workload distribution to ensure operational efficiency without compromising service quality.

Administrative Duties, Payroll, and Scheduling:

 Manage administrative tasks, payroll processing, and support staff schedules.
 Manage time-off and vacation requests without impacting salon operations.

Business Development:

 Identify growth opportunities and spearhead new business initiatives through client relationship management tactics.

Problem-Solving and Conflict Resolution:

 Consistently exhibit a solution-oriented attitude when facing challenges.
 Address and resolve internal conflicts swiftly, ensuring a harmonious work environment.

Social Media Management:

 Engage with and expand the online community by managing Le Petit Salon's social media platforms, ensuring consistent, brand-aligned content creation, prompt responses to inquiries, and active participation in relevant conversations.

Miscellaneous 

 Exhibit flexibility, handling tasks or responsibilities as assigned by ownership.
 Handle money and company property with respect and the highest level of honesty and integrity.

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

 Previous Experience: Previous management experience in a salon environment.
 Effective Leadership and Team Management: Proven capability in leading a team, fostering a supportive and growth-oriented environment.

PERSONAL QUALITIES

 Solution-Oriented: Ability to approach challenges with a positive, problem-solving mindset.
 Strong Leadership: Lead by example, inspiring trust and confidence among the team.
 Detail-Oriented: Maintain a keen eye for detail in every aspect of salon operations.
 Excellent Communication: Ability to communicate effectively with staff, clients, and Upper Management.
 Integrity: Uphold the highest standards of honesty and ethical behavior.
 Commitment to Growth: A strong believer in continuous personal and professional development.
 Customer-Centric: Always Prioritize and champion the wellbeing and loyalty of clients.
 Openness to Feedback: Welcomes feedback, seeing it as an avenue for personal growth and excellence.
 Stress Resilience: Maintains composure during busy or high-pressure situations.
 Engaging Personality: Easily establishes rapport with clients, making their experience feel personalized.
 Team Spirit: Works harmoniously with the entire Le Petit Salon team
 Passion for Learning: Eager to expand knowledge on the latest industry trends.

companyDescription:
Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. 
 
Actalent’s global footprint and flexible delivery models ensure access to specialized talent where and when you need it. We promote consultant engagement through professional development and provide experiences to ensure continuous learning. Our people are the difference.
 
Our expertise spans capabilities in engineering including product and manufacturing, systems and software, construction management, environmental, architecture and civil; and power and utilities. We focus on sciences capabilities in laboratory sciences, healthcare, and clinical research. 
 
Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at actalentservices.com.
description:
Actalent is seeking a Junior Technical Writer for our client in the Aerospace and Defense Industry
  Description:
  As a Technical Writer, you’ll be assigned to the development of a variety of documentation for software & hardware systems that help our client coordinate and conduct their tactical operations. You will work alongside the Team Lead on a day-to-day and collaborate directly with engineering teams to research and evaluate information to help with the development of documentation and information.
  Some of your key responsibilities:
 
  Write, rewrite, and/or edit technical documents such as technical procedure manuals, user manuals, programming manuals, service manuals, operational specifications, and related technical publications for a wide range of tactical systems.
  Acquires subject knowledge by collaborating and interviewing engineering and referring to technical specifications, blueprints, engineering illustrations, and trade journals.
  Conduct quality review of materials.
  Adhere to, and advise stakeholders on government publishing guidelines
  Collaborate with team members to improve internal processes and documenting any changes.
  Recommend and implement new documentation methods and formats that serve and satisfy technical and customer requirements.
 
  Requirements:
 
  Technical writing experience - 1 to 4 years
  Experience developing technical documentation for Software or Hardware systems ﻿
 
 
  Ability to manage multiple tasks independently 
 
 ***Remote job but the candidate must be in Ottawa or Calgary ***
  Additional Skills & Qualifications:
 
  Ability to synthesize complex technical data into concise end user documentation
  Experience developing structured technical documentation
  Experience with problem tracking tools, processes, and documentation defect resolution
 
  Working With Actalent
  Actalent is a worldwide leader in engineering consulting talent solutions. We specialize in supporting engineers with long-term opportunities, we're a company that hires passionate people and invest in their careers. You'll have the opportunity to work with diverse clients, whether you prefer the thrill of helping cutting-edge startups deploy the latest technology or the ability of impacting large corporations modernizing legacy systems. We cover a range of disciplines to address specific industry needs within different areas of specialization.
  We encourage you to apply as soon as possible!

companyDescription:
We're just getting started.

We consider it a privilege to be turning 100 years old. From designing the first patented down jacket in America to outfitting the first American ascent of Mt. Everest, we’ve built quite a legacy of inspiration, innovation, and exploration over the past century. But what’s even better than knowing where you’ve been? Being certain of your path forward. For the next 100 years our mission is to use what we’ve learned to inspire and enable all people to connect with the outdoors, and to create cutting-edge gear while reducing our impact on the environment.

Our environment is stimulating and dynamic, yet casual and collaborative. The kind of professional who thrives in this environment has a passion for Eddie Bauer and is driven by the desire to inspire our customers. They are innovative and collaborative. They live by the guide ethos – to work together to create success. As an esteemed brand with a century-long heritage in the outdoor world, we are collectively dedicated to helping our customers live their adventures.

In an effort to make lasting, impactful change, we’re continuing our commitment to becoming an anti-racist organization that promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion in our community and industry.
description:
Overview: 
 
   As an Assistant Store Manager, you will support the Store Manager to build a team that delivers results through providing an amazing customer experience. You also share the responsibility to execute all store operations and maintain a visually appealing store. You create a positive environment that develops and engages your managers, associates, and customers every day. You love being part of a winning team and you bring your energy to work every day. 
 
 
  The Assistant Store Manager reports to the Store Manager.
 
 
  Who You Are:
 
   Inspirational leader who guides their team and partners with the store manager to achieve great results. 
  Engaging personality who attracts great talent. 
  Demonstrates a competitive spirit and desire to win.
   Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
   Operates with a sense of urgency and effectively manage competing priorities.
   Able to adapt to change and takes on more responsibilities. 
  Self-motivated; seeks personal growth and development.
  Responsibilities: 
 
   As the Assistant Store Manager you will: 
   
    Partner with the Store Manager to create action plans to achieve results and grow the business.
     Understand and demonstrate product knowledge, selling and operational skills to maximize sales.
     Engage with customers to build relationships and brand loyalty by using company tools. 
    Partner with the Store Manager to develop team members who are committed to creating a great experience for our customers.
     Oversee assigned division of responsibility and be accountable for results. 
    Support the Store Manager to ensure store standards for merchandising and operations are met consistently. 
    Learn about all aspects of the business and share ideas to drive the business.
     Remain composed in the face of challenges and unforeseen circumstances. 
    Perform POS transactions on designated shifts and execute management functions in the absence of Store Manager.
     Model our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion, accountability, and inclusivity.
   
 
  
  Qualifications: 
 
   You will also have: 
   
    2+ years as a Co/Assistant Manager in similar volume, apparel business (preferred).
     Proven track record of exceeding sales and statistical expectations.
     Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends).
     May require occasional travel to other store locations (if needed).
   
 
  
  Requirements & EEO Statement: •Bend, lift, open and move product and fixtures up to 50 lbs., as needed. ** REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION The Company is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to enable qualified employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their jobs as required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
